intro: Cuervea crenulata, commonly known as the serrated cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces large, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a large, hairy pod that contains a viscous, nutrient-rich pulp. The botanical features of Cuervea crenulata make it an important species in both ecological and commercial contexts.
